result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Matthew Colborn

defendant.name: Colborn, Kyle Matthew
defendant.address: 7223 S. Parkview Cemetery Road, Hawthorne, WI 54842

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:41 AM Defendant Kyle Matthew Colborn appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Kyle Matthew Colborn.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Nelsen asks for a status in six weeks. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:57 AM Defendant Kyle Matthew Colborn in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Kyle Matthew Colborn.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen and Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Attorney Nelsen asks to be heard on bail. State has no objection. Attorney Nelsen notes that bail is set at $1500 and defendant thinks that employment would be available if he can get out and would lose chance at employment opportunity if he remains in custody. Asks for bail to be modified to $500-$1000. Defendant is not opposed to posting cash to be released as money would probably go towards arrearages. State is not opposed to some kind of reduction but is opposed to going as low as $500. State notes that defendant was in capias status for more than a year. State recites defendant's previous criminal history and FTAs. 

Court grants the motion for bail modification. Court thinks $1500 is justified but would like defendant to have employment. Court reduces bail to $1000. Conditions to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Comply with all court orders in family case (04FA75).

1:57 PM Court calls cases 04FA75 and 22CF360. Defendant Kyle Matthew Colborn appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Pierce from child support appears in family matter. Defendant's address confirmed. Court quashes warrants. 

In criminal matter, Attorney Hoffman makes a special appearance. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $750 cash bail. Comply with existing child support order. State recites prior criminal history and prior FTAs. Attorney Hoffman notes that defendant has employment and has lived at current address for over 10 years. Defendant is not on probation or parole and does not have any of the pending legal matters. Defendant is unable to post anything. Court notes concerns over FTA in criminal and family warrant. 
Court orders $1500 cash bail. Comply with all court orders in family case (04FA75).
Attorney Hoffman notes that he has qualified in the past but has not yet applied with the public defender. Defendant indicates he will apply with public defender. 

Court addresses Capias in family matter. Capias is cancelled. Court notes FTA at OTSC hearing in June. Defendant notes he was not given notice of the hearing in June, he in another state at that time. Attorney Pierce requests that the defendant be held in contempt. Looking to have him to be sentenced to 90 days in jail imposed and stayed, 2 years to purge, respondent will pay $100 to the trust before October 31,respondengt will pay $100 a month to arrears by the 1st of each month, will provide 10 days notice of any change of address or employment, proof of job search at 5 per week when unemployed or not paying, will keep monthly contact with child support whether employed or not. Cooperate with DWD program when not employed and if claiming he is unable to work must provide doctor verification every 4 months. Respondent agrees to the terms. 
Court finds defendant in contempt, orders respondent be be sentenced to 90 days in jail imposed and stayed, 2 years to purge, respondent will pay $100 to the trust before October 31,respondengt will pay $100 a month to arrears by the 1st of each month, will provide 10 days notice of any change of address or employment, proof of job search at 5 per week when unemployed or not paying, will keep monthly contact with child support whether employed or not. Cooperate with DWD program when not employed and if claiming he is unable to work must provide doctor verification every 4 months.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:45 am.
